intro: Orobus coccineus, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Orobus coccineus is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
